title: 113_s274
content: The Act may be cited as the "Children Eating Well Act" or the "CHEW Act". Definitions are provided in the Act. The Act defines terms such as "elementary school", "local educational agency", "secondary school", and "State educational agency" according to the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965. It also defines "programs to promote healthy eating and nutrition education" as initiatives that enhance students' ability to choose healthy foods, consider various influences on healthy eating, prepare students to make healthy choices as adults, and utilize scientifically sound nutritional materials and methods. The Act emphasizes the importance of using scientifically sound nutritional materials and methods supported by the most recent Dietary Guidelines for Americans. It also includes professional development programs for teachers, school staff, and food service workers to promote healthy eating and nutrition effectively in schools. Programs to promote healthy eating and nutrition education are emphasized in the Act. Local educational agencies receiving assistance under Title I of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act must develop and implement programs promoting healthy eating and nutrition education in schools, including integrating these programs throughout the school day and using educational materials emphasizing knowledge of healthy foods, especially fresh fruits and vegetables. The local educational agencies must emphasize knowledge of healthy foods, promote a balanced approach to diet and lifestyle, integrate healthy eating with physical activity, and implement various wellness activities to improve student understanding of nutrition. They should also periodically monitor schools' efforts in enhancing nutrition education among students. The local educational agency must consult various stakeholders to develop and implement programs promoting healthy eating and nutrition education, including families, students, school officials, and community organizations with nutrition expertise. The local educational agency consults stakeholders to develop and implement programs promoting healthy eating and nutrition education, including working with government authorities and school wellness councils. The local educational agency collaborates with stakeholders to develop and implement programs promoting healthy eating and nutrition education, integrating them with the school wellness policy. States must report on these programs to the Secretary of Education, including monitoring data collected from each agency. The Secretary of Education, Agriculture, and Health and Human Services will establish a task force to review and recommend effective nutrition education programs for schools. Appropriations are authorized for fiscal years 2014 through 2019.
